intro: Haplopappus cerberoanus subsp. elquianus, commonly known as the Elquianus dandelion, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptations to harsh climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a single head. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain herbivores.
